lead_paragraph: The Pyongyang International Film Festival gave outsiders a rare chance to mix with North Koreans while watching features promoting approved ideology.

byline.contributor: Reporting for this article was facilitated through the support of the Pulitzer Center for Crisis Reporting.

headline.print_headline: At North Korea’s International Film Fest, the Art of Promoting Ideology
headline.main: In North Korea, an International Film Festival Where ‘Self-Reliance’ Is the Star

snippet: The Pyongyang International Film Festival gave outsiders a rare chance to mix with North Koreans while watching features promoting approved ideology....
abstract: North Korea holds 15th biennial Pyongyang International Film Festival, in which movies from 21 countries are judged based on how well they articulate ideology of country’s founding father Kim Il-sung.
